Package neuroEvo

Class ConnectionGene

java.lang.Object
neuroEvo.Gene
neuroEvo.ConnectionGene
public class ConnectionGene
extends Gene
This class represents the Connections between 2 nodes
These Genes connect 2 NodeGenes from a source to destination. ConnectionGenes are initialized between these nodes with a randomized weight value. This weight is used in conjunction with the source node's value to create the forward pass value necessary in the Forward Propagation process.
Author:
Caleb Devon
Created 7/11/21

    • ConnectionGene

      protected ConnectionGene​(NodeGene src, NodeGene dest, boolean enabled)
      Parameters:
      src - Source Node of the connection
      dest - Destination Node of the connection
      enabled - Sets whether the connection will default to enabled

  • Method Details

    • known

      protected boolean known​(Gene other)
      Description copied from class: Gene
      This method is used for determining whether a newly created Gene is the first of its kind, or was already discovered in previous Genomes
      Specified by:
      known in class Gene
      Parameters:
      other - This is the Gene being compared to
      Returns:
      Returns true if the Gene is equivalent to the 'other' Gene

      Unlike the "equals" method, the "known" method compares internal variables to determine equivalence. The reason for this separation is that although the "equals" method may be easier to use, not all Genes will have their Innovation Numbers initialized before being compared.

    • getEnabled

      protected boolean getEnabled()
      Getter for the enabled characteristic
      Returns:
      returns whether the connection is enabled

      If the connection is currently loose this method will automatically return false

    • setHangingValues

      protected void setHangingValues​(boolean inHang, boolean outHang)
      Setter for the loose values
      Parameters:
      inHang - true if the Connection has no Source
      outHang - true if the Connection has no Destination
